title: Sexy Lessons. Lesson 4: Competing
body:
Warnings: swearing, a character pukes.. the usual

A/N: i don’t know how graduation works in Japan so this is based off my American graduation

there were a few lines in here that i didn’t know how to properly incorporate due to the POV so i just put them in parentheses.. hopefully it makes sense.

also, i purposefully didn’t specify who said the last line, it’s for you to decide.

First. Previous // Next

The bustle of students was louder than ever on this Friday afternoon. Why? Summer break, of course! And on top of that you were graduating! You stood in line to get the tickets. You nervously went over the details in your head. I’ll need one ticket for my mom and dad… One for my aunt. Umm.. Izuku would probably want to come.. so that’s four..

Ding!

 X: saw you at Mirio’s party last weekend… reminded me of some good times we used to have! we should hang out sometime.

 X: btw, you look really cute today..

You glanced at the messages on your phone screen. Your heartbeat quickened as you scanned your surroundings. Nothing looked out of the ordinary. Your fingers fumbled to type out your message.

Y/N: who is this?

The next message came immediately.

 X: take a wild guess, sweetheart.

You had absolutely no clue. You looked up into the sea of people with a frown on your face. Who was the mystery person? They had to be somewhere near you.

You felt an accidental shove from one of the students behind you causing you to trip over a raised piece of concrete. Your body couldn’t react quick enough. The ground was coming closer to your face. You braced for your stony face plant

Two strong arms wrapped around you. You were lifted back up with ease. “Falling for me all over again?” The voice chuckled from behind you. That voice. I know that voice. You turned to greet your savior.

 Shindou.

He smiled down at you, “Did you miss me?” You couldn’t begin to form a sentence. You mind raced. Why is he here? How did he find me? Why is he in his hero outfit? He looks so much taller now. And so much more.. muscular. Why did we break up again? “W-why are you—“

“Why am I here? Good question! Well, you see, Ketsubutsu’s 2nd years were doing some training. Our training partners were taking a while to get ready so I excused myself to use the restroom and decided to see what all this commotion was about. And then I saw your pretty little face and I sent you a text.”

It took you a minute to wrap your brain around what he just told you. “So you’re the mystery number person?” You pointed a finger at him. He nodded.

“And you went to Mirio’s party last weekend?” Your finger was still extended towards him. He nodded again and grabbed your hand, “ya know, I’m a little disappointed that you deleted my number and also,” his features darkened with a playful smirk as he stepped closer, “it’s not polite to point.” He winked at you and a surge pulsed through your body causing your stomach to flip.

Your knees felt weak; you grabbed on to him for support. “Shindou, what the hell was that!” You muttered looking up at the boy. “My quirk. It’s improved wouldn’t you say?” He held you close, providing the balance you needed. Improved was an understatement.

“It’s your turn to get your tickets,” he pointed you towards the ticket lady. She made you sign a few papers and then gave you an envelope with tickets. You decided that you would walk Shindou back to his class so the two of you could catch up.

As you and Shindou walked, the two of you talked about everything you could think of. It felt like the two of you had never been apart. You glanced into the envelope at your graduation tickets as Shindou told you about his latest adventure. One extra… should I give it to him? You glanced at Shindou. His eyes crinkled with his smile as he explained his story. So cute..

“Oh, so now you’re staring? Really, Y/N, what happened to your manners!” Shindou grinned down at you. You blushed slightly, looking away quickly. He stopped abruptly. You stopped as well—trying to avoid eye contact. “Don’t worry, I like when you look at me.” He tilted your head towards him.

Your cheeks burned as you made eye contact with him, “I, uh, I like looking at you..” God, that sounded so dumb. Way to be smooth, Y/N. He leaned in close to you, “you know, I really do miss you..”

“I-i missed you too,” Your eyes fluttered to his lips. He was so close…you could just—

“Is that Y/N!!! Who is she with! Midoriya do you know that guy?! He kinda looks like you but hotter!!”

 Izuku!

You stepped back from Shindou quickly and searched for the owner of the voice. It was that yellow haired boy from the party. He was pointing right at you and Shindou. Oh no. Your eyes scanned the crowd of underclassmen in their hero suits and you quickly found the hero Deku.

His eyes were already glued to the tall boy standing next to you. They fluttered to you. His stare was cold. You gave him a small wave. He forced a small smile. You cringed in the inside. He definitely saw that Shindou was just trying to make a move of you.

“Well, this is my stop!” Shindou smiled and gave your head a small pat. He stepped a bit closer to you, trying to recreate that opening from before.

“Wait… you’re training with class 1-A.” You raised an eyebrow at the boy. You place you hand against his chest to keep him and arms length away. You could feel Midoriya watching your every move. This probably looks bad from Izuku’s point of view…

“Yeah, we’re doing some one-on-one with them to train for the provisional license exam.” The boy looked out at the class he would be competing against, “I believe I’ll be training with the one you waved at. Is he your boyfriend or something?” Shindou shot you a look with his last question.

“Um, it’s a bit complicated—but he is a good friend” You looked away nervously. Complicated didn’t even begin to explain your relationship with Midoriya.

“Alright, class are you ready to have some fun!” The famed hero Ms. Joke pumped her fist into the air. “Come on, Aizawa, tell the students how much fun we’re gonna have!!” She nudged him with her elbow.

His sleepy eyes looked over the sea of students, “You’ve already been given your assignment. Take five minutes to introduce yourself to your partner then head to the training courts. Try not to kill each other. Ms. Joke and I will watch from the sidelines.”

“Gee, Aizawa, you’re such a buzzkill! It’s a wonder that I love you so~” Ms. Joke chatted off Aizawa’s ear as they walked towards the benches on the sidelines about how they should get married.

Shindou had you giggling over a silly little trick he could do with his quirk you didn’t even notice when Deku approached the two of you. He cleared his throat loudly, “ahem, hi there.. I’m Midoriya.” The green haired boy stuck his hand out between you and Shindou for a shake.

Shindou’s eyes lit up. He took Midoriya’s hand in the two of his, “Nice to meet you, Midoriya! I’m Shindou! I saw you on TV. Your fighting style is really unique!” Midoriya’s face contorted with confusion for a moment. He didn’t expect his partner to be so… friendly. He almost felt bad for being jealous.

“So, uh, Y/N,” Midoriya looked to you, “do you know Shindou..?” You looked into his puppy dog eyes. Dammit. A ping of guilt began to build up somewhere within. I have no reason to feel guilty! We’re not together… We’re ‘just friends.’

“Yeah, he’s my ex-boyfriend…” You looked down quickly as the words left your mouth. The air was thick between the three of you.

“Oh? Ex-boyfriend… funny you’ve never told me about him…” Midoriya’s voice probably still sounded happy to Shindou but you knew better. He was not happy with that new information.

“Make your way to the courts.” Aizawa ordered loudly. Groans surfaced throughout the classes. The students slowly made their ways to the courts. Shindou slung his arm around Midoriya. He stiffened at the touch. “Let’s head out, buddy!” Shindou had a smile plastered on his face as he dragged Midoriya to the court.  Before they were out of earshot, Shindou threw his head back to you, “You should stay and watch, Y/N!”  He then leaned in to Midoriya and whispered something. (“Listen I know you like her. But back off she’s mine… We’ve already dated before and I’m sure she sees you as just a friend and nothing more.. I wanna cut you a deal though, if I win this fight. You have to let me pursue her with no objections.”) Midoriya’s confused face was replaced with one of determination. Wonder what that was about..?

You sat at the bench closest to Midoriya and Shindou’s court. Shindou had a decent idea of how Midoriya was going to fight considering he watched the Sports Festival. Midoriya had improved so much since then though.

Shindou stared down the boy across from him. He had to be careful about how he was going to strike. There was no way to really focus his quirk unless…

Midoriya bolted at Shindou. Green lights flowed through his veins. He moved so quickly you could hardly keep track as he bunny hopped around Shindou. What was he doing?

Shindou was equally confused. He held his fists at bay; his head whipped around following the after image of Midoriya. (“You see.. while you were flirting it up with Y/N… I had some time to ask your classmates about your quirk.”) Just then, Midoriya landed a blow on Shindou’s cheek. He stumbled back before regaining his balance. Midoriya was already back to his bunny hopping.

Shindou closed his eyes. You idiot. Why would you take your eyes off your opponent! Midoriya saw this as an opening to give another hit. (“You can’t make a big quake because that will affect everyone out here and get your in trouble.. and if you can’t grab me then—“) Right before his fist landed, Shindou grabbed his wrist. Shindou’s eyes darkened sinisterly. He threw Midoriya over his shoulder to the ground.

Midoriya’s body ceased up. He turned over and retched. Shindou must’ve had used his quirk while he was flipping him. Shindou loomed over the boy who continued to get sick. He kicked Midoriya in the ribs, causing you to flinch. Midoriya’s head fell to the floor.

“Give it up, kid.” You heard Shindou spit out. His voice was seething with anger. Where did that come from? Midoriya struggled to lift himself up. Shindou kicked him again causing him to fall back to the ground. That can’t be allowed… You looked for Aizawa. He was currently preoccupied with trying to keep the loud angry boy from killing his partner.

Shindou placed his foot on Midoriya’s back. He said something that you couldn’t quite hear. (“We’re done here. Stay out of my way. Understand?”) Midoriya’s body seemed to deflate as Shindou showed you his best smile, he then helped Midoriya off the floor.

Shindou headed your way. Midoriya limped behind clutching his ribs. Shindou reached out to give you a high five but you pushed past him to aid Midoriya. “Hey, are you okay? Do we need to go to Recovery Girl?” Worry riddled your voice.

Midoriya let out a shaky sigh, “Yeah, I think my ribs—ah!” He whimpered, pressing against his stomach.

Your eyes shot up to Shindou, “why were you so rough! He’s hurt really bad!”

“No…no— Y/N,” Midoriya’s breath was labored, “it’s my fault. We made a bet… The stakes were high. I didn’t want to give up. Our specific training instructions were to treat our opponents as if they were a villain so.. he did exactly what he was supposed to.“

Your eyes softened as you looked at the boy in pain. You looked back to Shindou, “well… thanks for stopping when you did.. I know Midoriya is a bit hard headed… he doesn’t like giving up.”

     Later, in Recovery Girls office.

You smiled as you approached the doorway. Midoriya and Shindou’s laughter filled the air. You stood in the door frame and watched for a bit before you announced yourself. Midoriya sat up in the hospital bed propped up by some pillows and Shindou sat at the foot of his bed.

Shindou was telling Midoriya a story about a mucus villain he cane across when he was doing his internship, “it was so disgusting! I was literally covered in snot! It was the stretchy kind too!” He mimicked the stretching between his hands. Midoriya laughed, “That’s so gross!” It seemed like the two were finally getting along.

“Hey, guys.” You softly brought their attention to you. Their mannerisms were quite similar when they saw you. They both adjusted their posture as they took in your appearance. Neither of them tried to hide the fact they were checking you out.

“You look… beautiful.” Shindou seemed to be flabbergasted by your appearance. Midoriya nodded in agreement. You whispered a ‘thank you.’

“Um, yeah… my graduation is in like an hour… I came to bring you your ticket, Izuku.” Your heels tapped as you walked to the boy. Shindou’s eyes were heavy on your hips. Midoriya took the ticket from your hand, “thank you, Y/N! I’ll be there!”

You turned to the black haired boy to your left and held out a ticket for him as well, “I had an extra.. I know you said you wanted to hang out… I know technically you wouldn’t be hanging out with me but—“

“I would love to go.” Shindou took the ticket from your hand. His fingers brushed against yours momentarily. You felt a jolt rush through your body. Did he use his quirk on me again.. or was that just me?

You sighed happily, “I have to go to the rehearsal, but I’m glad to see you guys getting along! I knew the two of you could be good friends.” You patted their shoulders simultaneously before hopping out of the room. As the door clicked behind you, there was a hushed whisper—but you didn’t think too much of it.

     (“We are -not- friends.”)

Midoriya’s body ceased up. He turned over and retched. Shindou must’ve had used his quirk while he was flipping him. Shindou loomed over the boy who continued to get sick. He kicked Midoriya in the ribs, causing you to flinch. Midoriya’s head fell to the floor.

“Give it up, kid.” You heard Shindou spit out. His voice was seething with anger. Where did that come from? Midoriya struggled to lift himself up. Shindou kicked him again causing him to fall back to the ground. That can’t be allowed… You looked for Aizawa. He was currently preoccupied with trying to keep the loud angry boy from killing his partner.

Shindou placed his foot on Midoriya’s back. He said something that you couldn’t quite hear. (“We’re done here. Stay out of my way. Understand?”) Midoriya’s body seemed to deflate as Shindou showed you his best smile, he then helped Midoriya off the floor.

Shindou headed your way. Midoriya limped behind clutching his ribs. Shindou reached out to give you a high five but you pushed past him to aid Midoriya. “Hey, are you okay? Do we need to go to Recovery Girl?” Worry riddled your voice.

Midoriya let out a shaky sigh, “Yeah, I think my ribs—ah!” He whimpered, pressing against his stomach.

Your eyes shot up to Shindou, “why were you so rough! He’s hurt really bad!”

“No…no— Y/N,” Midoriya’s breath was labored, “it’s my fault. We made a bet… The stakes were high. I didn’t want to give up. Our specific training instructions were to treat our opponents as if they were a villain so.. he did exactly what he was supposed to.“

Your eyes softened as you looked at the boy in pain. You looked back to Shindou, “well… thanks for stopping when you did.. I know Midoriya is a bit hard headed… he doesn’t like giving up.”

     Later, in Recovery Girls office.

You smiled as you approached the doorway. Midoriya and Shindou’s laughter filled the air. You stood in the door frame and watched for a bit before you announced yourself. Midoriya sat up in the hospital bed propped up by some pillows and Shindou sat at the foot of his bed.

Shindou was telling Midoriya a story about a mucus villain he cane across when he was doing his internship, “it was so disgusting! I was literally covered in snot! It was the stretchy kind too!” He mimicked the stretching between his hands. Midoriya laughed, “That’s so gross!” It seemed like the two were finally getting along.

“Hey, guys.” You softly brought their attention to you. Their mannerisms were quite similar when they saw you. They both adjusted their posture as they took in your appearance. Neither of them tried to hide the fact they were checking you out.

“You look… beautiful.” Shindou seemed to be flabbergasted by your appearance. Midoriya nodded in agreement. You whispered a ‘thank you.’

“Um, yeah… my graduation is in like an hour… I came to bring you your ticket, Izuku.” Your heels tapped as you walked to the boy. Shindou’s eyes were heavy on your hips. Midoriya took the ticket from your hand, “thank you, Y/N! I’ll be there!”

You turned to the black haired boy to your left and held out a ticket for him as well, “I had an extra.. I know you said you wanted to hang out… I know technically you wouldn’t be hanging out with me but—“

“I would love to go.” Shindou took the ticket from your hand. His fingers brushed against yours momentarily. You felt a jolt rush through your body. Did he use his quirk on me again.. or was that just me?

You sighed happily, “I have to go to the rehearsal, but I’m glad to see you guys getting along! I knew the two of you could be good friends.” You patted their shoulders simultaneously before hopping out of the room. As the door clicked behind you, there was a hushed whisper—but you didn’t think too much of it.

     (“We are -not- friends.”)

First. Previous // Next

The bustle of students was louder than ever on this Friday afternoon. Why? Summer break, of course! And on top of that you were graduating! You stood in line to get the tickets. You nervously went over the details in your head. I’ll need one ticket for my mom and dad… One for my aunt. Umm.. Izuku would probably want to come.. so that’s four..

Ding!

 X: saw you at Mirio’s party last weekend… reminded me of some good times we used to have! we should hang out sometime.

 X: btw, you look really cute today..

You glanced at the messages on your phone screen. Your heartbeat quickened as you scanned your surroundings. Nothing looked out of the ordinary. Your fingers fumbled to type out your message.

Y/N: who is this?

The next message came immediately.

 X: take a wild guess, sweetheart.

You had absolutely no clue. You looked up into the sea of people with a frown on your face. Who was the mystery person? They had to be somewhere near you.

You felt an accidental shove from one of the students behind you causing you to trip over a raised piece of concrete. Your body couldn’t react quick enough. The ground was coming closer to your face. You braced for your stony face plant

Two strong arms wrapped around you. You were lifted back up with ease. “Falling for me all over again?” The voice chuckled from behind you. That voice. I know that voice. You turned to greet your savior.

[[MORE]]

 Shindou.

He smiled down at you, “Did you miss me?” You couldn’t begin to form a sentence. You mind raced. Why is he here? How did he find me? Why is he in his hero outfit? He looks so much taller now. And so much more.. muscular. Why did we break up again? “W-why are you—“

“Why am I here? Good question! Well, you see, Ketsubutsu’s 2nd years were doing some training. Our training partners were taking a while to get ready so I excused myself to use the restroom and decided to see what all this commotion was about. And then I saw your pretty little face and I sent you a text.”

It took you a minute to wrap your brain around what he just told you. “So you’re the mystery number person?” You pointed a finger at him. He nodded.

“And you went to Mirio’s party last weekend?” Your finger was still extended towards him. He nodded again and grabbed your hand, “ya know, I’m a little disappointed that you deleted my number and also,” his features darkened with a playful smirk as he stepped closer, “it’s not polite to point.” He winked at you and a surge pulsed through your body causing your stomach to flip.

Your knees felt weak; you grabbed on to him for support. “Shindou, what the hell was that!” You muttered looking up at the boy. “My quirk. It’s improved wouldn’t you say?” He held you close, providing the balance you needed. Improved was an understatement.

“It’s your turn to get your tickets,” he pointed you towards the ticket lady. She made you sign a few papers and then gave you an envelope with tickets. You decided that you would walk Shindou back to his class so the two of you could catch up.

As you and Shindou walked, the two of you talked about everything you could think of. It felt like the two of you had never been apart. You glanced into the envelope at your graduation tickets as Shindou told you about his latest adventure. One extra… should I give it to him? You glanced at Shindou. His eyes crinkled with his smile as he explained his story. So cute..

“Oh, so now you’re staring? Really, Y/N, what happened to your manners!” Shindou grinned down at you. You blushed slightly, looking away quickly. He stopped abruptly. You stopped as well—trying to avoid eye contact. “Don’t worry, I like when you look at me.” He tilted your head towards him.

Your cheeks burned as you made eye contact with him, “I, uh, I like looking at you..” God, that sounded so dumb. Way to be smooth, Y/N. He leaned in close to you, “you know, I really do miss you..”

“I-i missed you too,” Your eyes fluttered to his lips. He was so close…you could just—

“Is that Y/N!!! Who is she with! Midoriya do you know that guy?! He kinda looks like you but hotter!!”

 Izuku!

You stepped back from Shindou quickly and searched for the owner of the voice. It was that yellow haired boy from the party. He was pointing right at you and Shindou. Oh no. Your eyes scanned the crowd of underclassmen in their hero suits and you quickly found the hero Deku.

His eyes were already glued to the tall boy standing next to you. They fluttered to you. His stare was cold. You gave him a small wave. He forced a small smile. You cringed in the inside. He definitely saw that Shindou was just trying to make a move of you.

“Well, this is my stop!” Shindou smiled and gave your head a small pat. He stepped a bit closer to you, trying to recreate that opening from before.

“Wait… you’re training with class 1-A.” You raised an eyebrow at the boy. You place you hand against his chest to keep him and arms length away. You could feel Midoriya watching your every move. This probably looks bad from Izuku’s point of view…

“Yeah, we’re doing some one-on-one with them to train for the provisional license exam.” The boy looked out at the class he would be competing against, “I believe I’ll be training with the one you waved at. Is he your boyfriend or something?” Shindou shot you a look with his last question.

“Um, it’s a bit complicated—but he is a good friend” You looked away nervously. Complicated didn’t even begin to explain your relationship with Midoriya.

“Alright, class are you ready to have some fun!” The famed hero Ms. Joke pumped her fist into the air. “Come on, Aizawa, tell the students how much fun we’re gonna have!!” She nudged him with her elbow.

His sleepy eyes looked over the sea of students, “You’ve already been given your assignment. Take five minutes to introduce yourself to your partner then head to the training courts. Try not to kill each other. Ms. Joke and I will watch from the sidelines.”

“Gee, Aizawa, you’re such a buzzkill! It’s a wonder that I love you so~” Ms. Joke chatted off Aizawa’s ear as they walked towards the benches on the sidelines about how they should get married.

Shindou had you giggling over a silly little trick he could do with his quirk you didn’t even notice when Deku approached the two of you. He cleared his throat loudly, “ahem, hi there.. I’m Midoriya.” The green haired boy stuck his hand out between you and Shindou for a shake.

Shindou’s eyes lit up. He took Midoriya’s hand in the two of his, “Nice to meet you, Midoriya! I’m Shindou! I saw you on TV. Your fighting style is really unique!” Midoriya’s face contorted with confusion for a moment. He didn’t expect his partner to be so… friendly. He almost felt bad for being jealous.

“So, uh, Y/N,” Midoriya looked to you, “do you know Shindou..?” You looked into his puppy dog eyes. Dammit. A ping of guilt began to build up somewhere within. I have no reason to feel guilty! We’re not together… We’re ‘just friends.’

“Yeah, he’s my ex-boyfriend…” You looked down quickly as the words left your mouth. The air was thick between the three of you.

“Oh? Ex-boyfriend… funny you’ve never told me about him…” Midoriya’s voice probably still sounded happy to Shindou but you knew better. He was not happy with that new information.

“Make your way to the courts.” Aizawa ordered loudly. Groans surfaced throughout the classes. The students slowly made their ways to the courts. Shindou slung his arm around Midoriya. He stiffened at the touch. “Let’s head out, buddy!” Shindou had a smile plastered on his face as he dragged Midoriya to the court.  Before they were out of earshot, Shindou threw his head back to you, “You should stay and watch, Y/N!”  He then leaned in to Midoriya and whispered something. (“Listen I know you like her. But back off she’s mine… We’ve already dated before and I’m sure she sees you as just a friend and nothing more.. I wanna cut you a deal though, if I win this fight. You have to let me pursue her with no objections.”) Midoriya’s confused face was replaced with one of determination. Wonder what that was about..?

You sat at the bench closest to Midoriya and Shindou’s court. Shindou had a decent idea of how Midoriya was going to fight considering he watched the Sports Festival. Midoriya had improved so much since then though.

Shindou stared down the boy across from him. He had to be careful about how he was going to strike. There was no way to really focus his quirk unless…

Midoriya bolted at Shindou. Green lights flowed through his veins. He moved so quickly you could hardly keep track as he bunny hopped around Shindou. What was he doing?

Shindou was equally confused. He held his fists at bay; his head whipped around following the after image of Midoriya. (“You see.. while you were flirting it up with Y/N… I had some time to ask your classmates about your quirk.”) Just then, Midoriya landed a blow on Shindou’s cheek. He stumbled back before regaining his balance. Midoriya was already back to his bunny hopping.

“No…no— Y/N,” Midoriya’s breath was labored, “it’s my fault. We made a bet… The stakes were high. I didn’t want to give up. Our specific training instructions were to treat our opponents as if they were a villain so.. he did exactly what he was supposed to.“

“I would love to go.” Shindou took the ticket from your hand. His fingers brushed against yours momentarily. You felt a jolt rush through your body. Did he use his quirk on me again.. or was that just me?

You sighed happily, “I have to go to the rehearsal, but I’m glad to see you guys getting along! I knew the two of you could be good friends.” You patted their shoulders simultaneously before hopping out of the room. As the door clicked behind you, there was a hushed whisper—but you didn’t think too much of it.

     (“We are -not- friends.”)
trail.content_abstract:
Warnings: swearing, a character pukes.. the usual

A/N: i don’t know how graduation works in Japan so this is based off my American graduation

there were a few lines in here that i didn’t know how to properly incorporate due to the POV so i just put them in parentheses.. hopefully it makes sense.

also, i purposefully didn’t specify who said the last line, it’s for you to decide.

First. Previous // Next

The bustle of students was louder than ever on this Friday afternoon. Why? Summer break, of course! And on top of that you were graduating! You stood in line to get the tickets. You nervously went over the details in your head. I’ll need one ticket for my mom and dad… One for my aunt. Umm.. Izuku would probably want to come.. so that’s four..

Ding!

 X: saw you at Mirio’s party last weekend… reminded me of some good times we used to have! we should hang out sometime.

 X: btw, you look really cute today..

You glanced at the messages on your phone screen. Your heartbeat quickened as you scanned your surroundings. Nothing looked out of the ordinary. Your fingers fumbled to type out your message.

Y/N: who is this?

The next message came immediately.

 X: take a wild guess, sweetheart.

You had absolutely no clue. You looked up into the sea of people with a frown on your face. Who was the mystery person? They had to be somewhere near you.

You felt an accidental shove from one of the students behind you causing you to trip over a raised piece of concrete. Your body couldn’t react quick enough. The ground was coming closer to your face. You braced for your stony face plant

Two strong arms wrapped around you. You were lifted back up with ease. “Falling for me all over again?” The voice chuckled from behind you. That voice. I know that voice. You turned to greet your savior.

summary: I’ve been playing a My Hero Academia roleplay game recently, run by my fiance. I did some art for this. I’ve tried to do a...
caption:
I’ve been playing a My Hero Academia roleplay game recently, run by my fiance.

I did some art for this. I’ve tried to do a couple of different styles. It also took a while for one of the guys to tell me what his character actually looked like so there’s only one pic where I’ve attempted his beard.

So for the picture in 5 sections we have from left to right:
Yuri, his quirk is illusions.
Takeo Kimyona, he’s quirkless but hasn’t really told anyone yet.
Chishio Kaguyaku, he’s basically a vampire??
Norio Tokito, he is all about that biomanipulation.
Emelie Bell, she can basically become a shadow, and teleport.
